sentence.Network_en: We passed the desiccated corpse of a brigand hanging on a gibbet.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们路过一具悬在绞刑架上的土匪干尸.

sentence.Network_en: There were hundreds and perhaps thousands of such practically independent brigand rulers.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种事实上独立的强盗统治者有几百个,甚至可能几千个.

sentence.Network_en: The poacher , like the smuggler, smacks too strongly of the brigand.
sentence.Network_cn: 私自打猎的人正如走私的人, 都和土匪相去不远.

list.abs: the key to growth was redirecting the entrepreneurial energy of von Hohenfels from brigands to productive business .增长的关键是将冯?霍恩费尔斯之流的企业家能量从强盗行为引向生产性业务。
This episode reflects the history of the two brigands ., 这就是这两个强盗的历史.
owing to the extraordinary apathy of the inhabitants , the brigands were able to carry out their depredations undisturbed .由于居民们的极度麻木，这些强盗的抢劫生涯真过得消遥自在。
" Peppino ,' said brigand chief , " give me the torch . "“庇皮诺,”那个强盗头儿说道,“把火把给我.”

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (also denoting AN irregular foot soldier): from Old French, from Italian brigante, literally ('person) contending', from brigare 'contend' (see brigade)

entry.def: A brigand is someone who attacks people and robs them, especially in mountains or forests.

means.word_mean: 1. an armed thief who is (usually) a member of a band

sentences.en: They say there are brigands hiding along the way.
sentences.cn: 他们说沿路隐藏着土匪。

sentences.en: We passed the desiccated corpse of a brigand hanging on a gibbet.
sentences.cn: 我们路过一具悬在绞刑架上的土匪干尸。
